body:
This has me scratching my head as to why you'd do that?

What's the use case?

Can you share all the stuff and use the template to actually report an issue?
I have used rclone from cmake to synchronize a source directory to build directory and the target path use '..' to access parent directory
Ok - why do you use that in your rclone command though and not just the path?

Is this an accurate test case like you were describing?

```
felix@gemini:~$ rclone sync /home/felix/test1 /home/felix/test2/onedir/../onedir -vv
2022/10/14 10:29:04 DEBUG : Setting --config "/opt/rclone/rclone.conf" from environment variable RCLONE_CONFIG="/opt/rclone/rclone.conf"
2022/10/14 10:29:04 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.59.2" starting with parameters ["rclone" "sync" "/home/felix/test1" "/home/felix/test2/onedir/../onedir" "-vv"]
2022/10/14 10:29:04 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "/home/felix/test1"
2022/10/14 10:29:04 DEBUG : Using config file from "/opt/rclone/rclone.conf"
2022/10/14 10:29:04 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "/home/felix/test2/onedir/../onedir"
2022/10/14 10:29:04 DEBUG : fs cache: renaming cache item "/home/felix/test2/onedir/../onedir" to be canonical "/home/felix/test2/onedir/．．/onedir"
2022/10/14 10:29:04 DEBUG : Local file system at /home/felix/test2/onedir/．．/onedir: Waiting for checks to finish
2022/10/14 10:29:04 DEBUG : Local file system at /home/felix/test2/onedir/．．/onedir: Waiting for transfers to finish
2022/10/14 10:29:04 DEBUG : file: md5 = d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e OK
2022/10/14 10:29:04 INFO  : file: Copied (new)
2022/10/14 10:29:04 DEBUG : Waiting for deletions to finish
2022/10/14 10:29:04 INFO  :
Transferred:   	          0 B / 0 B, -, 0 B/s, ETA -
Transferred:            1 / 1, 100%
Elapsed time:         0.0s

2022/10/14 10:29:04 DEBUG : 4 go routines active
felix@gemini:~$ cd test2
felix@gemini:~/test2$ ls -alR
.:
total 0
drwxrwxr-x 1 felix felix  12 Oct 14 10:28 .
drwxr-x--- 1 felix felix 288 Oct 14 10:28 ..
drwxrwxr-x 1 felix felix  12 Oct 14 10:29 onedir

./onedir:
total 0
drwxrwxr-x 1 felix felix 12 Oct 14 10:29 .
drwxrwxr-x 1 felix felix 12 Oct 14 10:28 ..
drwxrwxr-x 1 felix felix 12 Oct 14 10:29 ．．

./onedir/．．:
total 0
drwxrwxr-x 1 felix felix 12 Oct 14 10:29 .
drwxrwxr-x 1 felix felix 12 Oct 14 10:29 ..
drwxrwxr-x 1 felix felix  8 Oct 14 10:29 onedir

./onedir/．．/onedir:
total 0
drwxrwxr-x 1 felix felix  8 Oct 14 10:29 .
drwxrwxr-x 1 felix felix 12 Oct 14 10:29 ..
-rw-rw-r-- 1 felix felix  0 Oct 14 10:28 file
```

I get slightly different results on Linux/MacOS. I'm testing primarily on Linux above.

I create the path using cmake variables. for example:
`COMMAND ${RCLONE_COMMAND} sync ${CMAKE_SOURCE_DIR}/Assets $<TARGET_FILE_DIR:MyProgram>/../Assets`

Yes, the test case is right

Gotcha - thanks!

I did a quick test with rsync and that works properly just for some sanity.

```
felix@gemini:~$ rsync -avh /home/felix/test1 /home/felix/test2/onedir/../onedir/
sending incremental file list
test1/
test1/file

sent 133 bytes  received 39 bytes  344.00 bytes/sec
total size is 0  speedup is 0.00
felix@gemini:~$ cd test2
felix@gemini:~/test2$ ls
onedir
felix@gemini:~/test2$ ls -alR
.:
total 0
drwxrwxr-x 1 felix felix  12 Oct 14 10:36 .
drwxr-x--- 1 felix felix 288 Oct 14 10:28 ..
drwxrwxr-x 1 felix felix  10 Oct 14 10:36 onedir

./onedir:
total 0
drwxrwxr-x 1 felix felix 10 Oct 14 10:36 .
drwxrwxr-x 1 felix felix 12 Oct 14 10:36 ..
drwxrwxr-x 1 felix felix  8 Oct 14 10:28 test1

./onedir/test1:
total 0
drwxrwxr-x 1 felix felix  8 Oct 14 10:28 .
drwxrwxr-x 1 felix felix 10 Oct 14 10:36 ..
-rw-rw-r-- 1 felix felix  0 Oct 14 10:28 file
```

@ncw - I think it's doing something translating the path there is something goes wrong here:

```
2022/10/14 10:29:04 DEBUG : fs cache: renaming cache item "/home/felix/test2/onedir/../onedir" to be canonical "/home/felix/test2/onedir/．．/onedir"
```

That is the path that looks wrong.
Maybe it's accidentally converting the periods to their wide-chars? At least that's my guess from the log of the conversion having different spacing from before it's converted to after

> Maybe it's accidentally converting the periods to their wide-chars?

That is a very good guess. :) If the path is absolute then it will not be cleaned (resolved) by the local backend, and the periods will be encoded according to the [backend encoding](https://rclone.org/local/#filenames). A relative path is made absolute first, and this process implicitly performs clean (resolve) and would work in your case as well. I will look into fixing the missing clean of absolute paths.

issue.title: Clean absolute paths in local backend

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### What is the purpose of this change?

In existing version, relative paths are made absolute with `filepath.Abs`, which implicitely performs a `filepath.Clean` which eliminates path elements such as `..`. But paths that are already absolute are not cleaned, which means a path element `..` will be kept and encoded according to backend encoding.

This PR adds a call to `filepath.Clean` for absolute paths, making it more consistent.

Windows paths with prefix `\\` are excluded from this, they were already excluded from `filepath.Abs` in existing version, as UNC paths cannot be relative (this is documented) nor contain "relative" path elements (undocumented, but at least the `dir` command such as `dir \\?\C:\Some\Path\..\OtherPath` errors with "The filename, directory name, or volume label syntax is incorrect", and also, in any case, this means using `\\?` prefix can be used as workaround in case the Clean/Abs leads to problems).

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

Fixes #6493

#### Checklist

- [X] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-new-feature-or-bug-fix).
- [ ] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [ ] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [X] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [X] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)
